entry.title: RANK drives structured intestinal epithelial expansion during pregnancy (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
RANK drives structured intestinal epithelial expansion during pregnancy

The RANKâ€“RANKL pathway drives intestinal epithelial expansion in pregnancy and lactation.

  • Masahiro Onji
  • Verena Sigl
  • Josef M. Penninger
ArticleOpen Access04 Dec 2024

entry.title: In situ spheroid formation in distant submillimetre-bright galaxies (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
In situ spheroid formation in distant submillimetre-bright galaxies

Deep ALMA archival observations of submillimetre-bright galaxies at high redshifts show that spheroidal bulges formed much earlier than expected and are directly generated by star formation within the cores of highly luminous starburst galaxies.

  • Qing-Hua Tan
  • Emanuele Daddi
  • Francesco Valentino
Article04 Dec 2024

entry.title: Mis-splicing of a neuronal microexon promotes CPEB4 aggregation in ASD (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Mis-splicing of a neuronal microexon promotes CPEB4 aggregation in ASD

The molecular mechanisms of how small changes in the degree of inclusion of a neuron-specific microexon in CPEB4 lead to dominant-negative effects in the expression of genes associated with autism spectrum disorder are identified.

  • Carla Garcia-Cabau
  • Anna Bartomeu
  • Xavier Salvatella
ArticleOpen Access04 Dec 2024

entry.title: Macrophages excite muscle spindles with glutamate to bolster locomotion (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Macrophages excite muscle spindles with glutamate to bolster locomotion

A population of macrophages with exclusive molecular and functional signatures in the muscle spindles express machinery for synthesizing and releasing glutamate, and a cellular component, the muscle spindle macrophages, directly regulates neural activity and muscle contraction.

  • Yuyang Yan
  • Nuria Antolin
  • Simone Di Giovanni
ArticleOpen Access04 Dec 2024

entry.title: Isoprene nitrates drive new particle formation in Amazonâ€™s upper troposphere (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Isoprene nitrates drive new particle formation in Amazonâ€™s upper troposphere

Aircraft measurements over the Amazon show that new particle formation in the upper troposphere emerges when isoprene, emitted by forests, undergoes oxidation in the presence of nitrogen oxides produced by lightning.

  • Joachim Curtius
  • Martin Heinritzi
  • Jos Lelieveld
ArticleOpen Access04 Dec 2024

entry.title: Tracking transcriptionâ€“translation coupling in real time (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Tracking transcriptionâ€“translation coupling in real time

Single-molecule fluorescence microscopy experiments with a recombinant Escherichia coli transcriptionâ€“translation system provides insights into the coordination of the transcription and translation machineries mediated by the intervening mRNA.

  • Nusrat Shahin Qureshi
  • Olivier Duss
ArticleOpen Access04 Dec 2024

entry.title: Synthetic GPCRs for programmable sensing and control of cell behaviour (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Synthetic GPCRs for programmable sensing and control of cell behaviour

Modular synthetic G-protein-coupled receptors with nanobody-based ligand-recognition domains can be designed and used to programme transgene expression, real-time fluorescence or endogenous G-protein activation in response to soluble or cell-surface ligands, enabling control of diverse cellular behaviours.

  • Nicholas A. Kalogriopoulos
  • Reika Tei
  • Alice Ting
ArticleOpen Access04 Dec 2024

entry.title: Fast ground-to-air transition with avian-inspired multifunctional legs (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Fast ground-to-air transition with avian-inspired multifunctional legs

A bird-inspired robot that can jump into flight, walk on the ground and hop over obstacles shows that jumping for take-off is more energy efficient than taking off without the jump.

  • Won Dong Shin
  • Hoang-Vu Phan
  • Dario Floreano
Article04 Dec 2024

entry.title: Ageing limits stemness and tumorigenesis by reprogramming iron homeostasis (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Ageing limits stemness and tumorigenesis by reprogramming iron homeostasis

Studies using mouse models of lung adenocarcinoma identify an association between age, iron homeostasis and tumour initiation potential that involves NUPR1 and lipocalin-2.

  • Xueqian Zhuang
  • Qing Wang
  • Tuomas Tammela
Article04 Dec 2024

entry.title: The oestrous cycle stage affects mammary tumour sensitivity to chemotherapy (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
The oestrous cycle stage affects mammary tumour sensitivity to chemotherapy

In three mouse models of breast cancer, we show reduced responses to neoadjuvant chemotherapy when treatment is initiated during the dioestrus stage, when compared with initiation during the oestrus stage.

  • Laura Bornes
  • Lennart J. van Winden
  • Jacco van Rheenen
ArticleOpen Access04 Dec 2024

entry.title: New particle formation from isoprene under upper-tropospheric conditions (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
New particle formation from isoprene under upper-tropospheric conditions

Experiments performed in the CERN CLOUD chamber show that, under upper-tropospheric conditions, new atmospheric particle formation may be initiated by the reaction of hydroxyl radicals with isoprene emitted by rainforests.

  • Jiali Shen
  • Douglas M. Russell
  • Xu-Cheng He
ArticleOpen Access04 Dec 2024

entry.title: Probabilistic weather forecasting with machine learning (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Probabilistic weather forecasting with machine learning

GenCast, a probabilistic weather model using artificial intelligence for weather forecasting, has greater skill and speed than the top operational medium-range weather forecast in the world and provides probabilistic, rather than deterministic, forecasts.

  • Ilan Price
  • Alvaro Sanchez-Gonzalez
  • Matthew Willson
ArticleOpen Access04 Dec 2024

entry.title: Evolution of myeloid-mediated immunotherapy resistance in prostate cancer (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Evolution of myeloid-mediated immunotherapy resistance in prostate cancer

Single-cell profiling of human prostate cancer and studies in mouse models show that macrophages expressing SPP1 mediate immunotherapeutic resistance through adenosine pathway activation and represent a potential target for future studies.

  • Aram Lyu
  • Zenghua Fan
  • Lawrence Fong
ArticleOpen Access04 Dec 2024

entry.title: Near-identical macromolecules spontaneously partition into concentric circles (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Near-identical macromolecules spontaneously partition into concentric circles

A particular liquidâ€“liquid phase separation at a solidâ€“liquid interface led to the unexpected partitioning of highly similar polymeric molecules into concentric circles.

  • Hao Gong
  • Yuriko Sakaguchi
  • Takuzo Aida
Article04 Dec 2024

entry.title: Fetal hepatocytes protect the HSPC genome via fetuin-A (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Fetal hepatocytes protect the HSPC genome via fetuin-A

A mechanism is uncovered that results in fetal hepatocytes having a paracrine role in providing genome protection to haematopoietic stem and progenitor cells.

  • Xiao-Lin Guo
  • Yi-Ding Wang
  • Deng-Li Hong
ArticleOpen Access04 Dec 2024

entry.title: Dietary fructose enhances tumour growth indirectly via interorgan lipid transfer (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Dietary fructose enhances tumour growth indirectly via interorgan lipid transfer

Dietary fructose enhances tumour growth in animal models of melanoma, breast cancer and cervical cancer indirectly via metabolite transfer.

  • Ronald Fowle-Grider
  • Joe L. Rowles III
  • Gary J. Patti
Article04 Dec 2024

entry.title: Understanding the neural code of stress to control anhedonia (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Understanding the neural code of stress to control anhedonia

Examination of the neural activity in the basolateral amygdala and ventral CA1 of mice during tasks or rest following exposure to social stress reveals signatures of resilience and susceptibility to stress.

  • Frances Xia
  • Valeria Fascianelli
  • Mazen A. Kheirbek
ArticleOpen Access04 Dec 2024

entry.title: Digestive contents and food webs record the advent of dinosaur supremacy (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Digestive contents and food webs record the advent of dinosaur supremacy

Integrated analyses of bromalites provide robust pictures of past food webs, explaining early dinosaur evolution and the emergence of larger dinosaur faunas with new feeding patterns.

  • Martin QvarnstrÃ¶m
  • Joel Vikberg WernstrÃ¶m
  • Grzegorz NiedÅºwiedzki
